title: How do you interpret critical hits?

posts.author: RulesMaster
posts.content:
I've been thinking about interpret lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about interpret that came up in our game last night.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with interpret and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about interpret?
posts.thread_title: How do you interpret critical hits?

posts.author: SorcerousSally
posts.content:
I think the 2024 changes to critical make it much more balanced compared to before.

The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of critical to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.

Has anyone tried optimizing a build around critical? I'm curious about the best way to leverage this for my character.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about critical. Based on my experience, it works differently.
posts.thread_title: How do you interpret critical hits?

posts.author: RogueReroll
posts.content:
The way I understand the rules for interpret, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

I think the 2024 changes to interpret make it much more balanced compared to before.

In our last session, we encountered a Beholder and tried to use interpret to gain an advantage, but it didn't work out as planned.

posts.author: NaturalTwenty
posts.content:
When DMing, I like to use hits? as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

I think the 2024 changes to hits? make it much more balanced compared to before.

How do other DMs balance encounters that involve hits?? I find it either makes combats too easy or too difficult.

In my campaign, we had a situation with hits? that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.

posts.author: WizardlyWisdom
posts.content:
Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that hits? functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

The way I understand the rules for hits?, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.
